thread.title: Former Chinese oil chief jailed for 16 years
thread.title_full: Former Chinese oil chief jailed for 16 years | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: Former Chinese oil chief jailed for 16 years
text:
The former chief of China's biggest oil company and a onetime top official overseeing its biggest state-owned enterprises was sentenced to 16 years in prison for bribery, state media said on Monday.
On its verified Weibo social media account on Monday, official broadcaster China Central Television said Jiang Jiemin wouldn't appeal his sentence. Mr Jiang has been unreachable for comment.
CCTV said the court found that Mr Jiang abused his power as a top official and possessed large amounts of property of unknown origin. It said he would have to surrender 1 million yuan ($US157,600) in assets.
Mr Jiang was once chairman of China National Petroleum Corp., the country's largest oil producer by volume. In 2013, he was named the top official at the China State-Owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission, which oversees state-run companies that dominate China's oil, telecommunications and other key parts of the Chinese economy.
